What We Do

The Allure of Sports. The Thrill of Wall Street.

At its core, the Phoenix Sports Exchange is a marketplace for investing in sports based securities. In regular companies, we can buy a share of the company for a price. For example, we can buy one share of Apple for $100. When we buy the share, we make money when the company does well (successful new iPhone, increase in earnings) because people are willing to pay more for a share in the company. We lose money when the company does poorly (failed product, reduced earnings) because people donâ€™t want to spend as much money for a share. This basic concept of investing is what the Phoenix Sports Exchange is based on.

Home Page

When users come to the homepage they will find a stock ticker with up-to-date stock prices and recent news that may affect these prices.

Users will also be able to search for specific stocks or filter by their favorite city or sport.
